definition: generic term for cotton or kapok/cotton/padded or quilted with cotton

sentences.english: In major cotton-producing areas, the management of cotton fields is mostly undertaken by women.
sentences.chinese: 产棉区的棉田管理大部分由妇女承担。

sentences.english: The dynamics of the natural enemy community was studied.
sentences.chinese: 研究了棉田天敌群落时序动态。
他们在棉田里挖了水渠。

sentences.english: Clyde pulled over, and Gussie hopped out and plunged into the cotton.
sentences.chinese: 克莱德把车驶到路边，格西跳下车，一头钻进棉田。

sentences.english: This clearly indicated that the desert transition zone provided resource of the parasite natural enemy insect for the cotton field.
sentences.chinese: 荒漠过渡带为棉田提供了丰富的寄生性天敌资源。

sentences.english: The paper study on soil moisture dynamic change of drip irrigation cotton field.
sentences.chinese: 本文研究了额济纳绿洲滴灌棉田的土壤水分动态变化。

sentences.english: They were working in the cotton fields.

definition: early season rice/rice at transplanting or still unripe
tiller (stem at the base of grass plants)
the embryonic development of grain while still on the stem
to sprout/to come out (of seedling)/to bud
cotton boll splits open and reveals its white interior
(of plants) to turn green again/to revegetate
the state of moisture in the soil (and whether it can support a crop)
